config.section.name: Recommended for Pokemon Trinkets
config.PokemonXanEarlyTrinketSlot.name: Enable early trinket slot?
config.PokemonXanEarlyTrinketSlot.descri: Gives the player the trinket slot without needing combat mastery
config.PokemonXanEnablePacifist.name: Enable Pacifist mode?
config.PokemonXanEnablePacifist.descript: Player does not need to attack Pokemon and Pokemon won't attack players
Terrarium.CategoryDescription:
Only used to make into a Terrarium for the specified Pokémon.
This allows hiding Pokémon to be visible.
Spiritomb.Name: Spiritomb
Spiritomb.Mon: $q Q1_yes/Q1_no Spiritomb_fallback#Do you know of Pocket Monsters?#$r Q1_yes 0 Q1_reaction_yes#You mean Pokemon?.#$r Q1_no 0 Q1_reaction_no#No, what's that?.
Spiritomb.Tue: $q Q1_yes/Q1_no Spiritomb_fallback#Do you know of Pocket Monsters?#$r Q1_yes 0 Q1_reaction_yes#You mean Pokemon?.#$r Q1_no 0 Q1_reaction_no#No, what's that?.
Spiritomb.Wed: $q Q1_yes/Q1_no Spiritomb_fallback#Do you know of Pocket Monsters?#$r Q1_yes 0 Q1_reaction_yes#You mean Pokemon?.#$r Q1_no 0 Q1_reaction_no#No, what's that?.

Spiritomb.GreenRain: %Spiritomb is mesmerised by the rain...#$b#$q Q1_yes/Q1_no Spiritomb_fallback#Do you know of Pocket Monsters?#$r Q1_yes 0 Q1_reaction_yes#You mean Pokemon?.#$r Q1_no 0 Q1_reaction_no#No, what's that?.
Spiritomb.GreenRain_2: %Spiritomb is mesmerised by the rain...#$b#$q Q1_yes/Q1_no Spiritomb_fallback#Do you know of Pocket Monsters?#$r Q1_yes 0 Q1_reaction_yes#You mean Pokemon?.#$r Q1_no 0 Q1_reaction_no#No, what's that?.
Q1_reaction_yes: $q Q2_why/Q2_ok#Is that what they're calling it now? I kind of liked that we were called monsters.$1#$b#Well if you catch any, don't just leave them in your pocket.$0#$b#Donate them to that Insectarium over there.#$r Q2_why 0 Q2_reaction_why#Why? What do I get out of it?#$r Q2_ok 0 Q2_reaction_ok#Yeah sure, no problem.
Q1_reaction_no: $q Q2_why/Q2_ok#What really? Maybe it's called something different these days.$3#$b#Anyway, if you see any strange looking creatures, don't just hang on to them or sell them.#$b#Donate them to that Insectarium over there.#$r Q2_why 0 Q2_reaction_why#Why? What do I get out of it?#$r Q2_ok 0 Q2_reaction_ok#Yeah sure, no problem.
Q2_reaction_why: Huh?! Aren't you the least bit curious?$3#$b#Anyway, you should start seeing Pokemon tomorrow.$0#$b#I'll be waiting here, you won't regret it.$0#$action AddMail All PokeGroup1_Include received
Q2_reaction_ok: Great! You should start seeing Pokemon tomorrow.$1#$b#I'll be waiting here when you're finished.$1#$action AddMail All PokeGroup1_Include received
Q3_all: You actually caught and donated them all?$1#$b#Well I guess I could reward you...$0#$b#Talk to me to go somewhere new and check Ivy's shop for Pokemon contracts.#$b#Oh! I almost forgot!$3#$b#You'll see some new Pokemon around, so check with me when you've donated some more.$1#$action AddMail All PokeGroup2_Include received
Q3_some: You've donated some but it's not enough.$0#$b#If you donate them all something good might happen.$1
Q3_none: You have to start donating Pokemon to the Insectarium first...$2
Q4_all: You did it again! Well.. of course you did..$1#$b#And you want another reward right?$0#$b#Check Ivy's shop, nothing comes for free.$0#$b#...$2#$b#Oh you want more Pokemon right?$1#$b#Check tomorrow, you might find some around the usual places and some new places too.$0#$action AddMail All PokeGroup3_Include received
Q4_some: You've donated some but it's not enough.$0#$b#You know the drill, keep going!$1
Q4_none: You haven't donated any new Pokemon yet..$2
Q5_all: There's no stopping you is there?$1#$b#Well it has finally come to this. Our worlds are going to be more tangled than a Tangela!$1#$b#What does this mean? Well I guess you won't need to check your progress with me anymore, I think you've mastered it.$0#$b#Oh but don't worry, I'll still be here..$0
Q5_some: You still have more to donate.$0#$b#Keep it up!$1
Q5_none: You haven't donated any new Pokemon yet..$2
SafariGrassItem.Description: It's not very useful, but it is certainly stubborn.
SafariGrass.Description: Grows into Safari grass. Takes 4 days to grow.
PechaFruitItem.Description: A sweet, delicate fruit that can sometimes be mistaken for a peach.
PechaFruit.Description: Grows into a small Pecha tree. Takes 5 days to grow and can harvest each day.
OranFruitItem.Description: An abnormally large berry that tastes like different fruits mixed together.
OranFruit.Description: Grows into a small Oran tree. Takes 5 days to grow and can harvest each day.
CheriFruitItem.Description: A spicy fruit that is comparable to some of the hottest chilli.
CheriFruit.Description: Grows into a small Cheri tree. Takes 5 days to grow and can harvest each day.
OranSmoothie.Description: A bright, tangy blend of berry goodness.
CheriSmoothie.Description:
A sweet, creamy blend that still has quite a bit of kick!
+10% Attack Speed
PechaSmoothie.Description: The silky texture and sweet taste is almost like a dessert.
PokeGroup1Contract.Description:
Adds donated Pokemon to the Safari Zone.
Pokemon caught there may drop items.
Also grants access to new quest board.
PokeGroup2Contract.Description:
Adds more donated Pokemon to the Safari Zone.
Also grants access to the house in the Safari Zone.
PokeGroup3Contract.Description:
Adds the recently donated Pokemon to a new area of the Safari Zone.
Be wary there have been reports of electric mice!
GastlyTrinket.Description:
Uses Hypnosis to lull foes into a slumber.

Lv.{0}: {1}
GastlyTrinket.Level1: Occasionally puts enemies to sleep with Hypnosis
GastlyTrinket.Level2: Puts enemies to sleep longer at a faster rate.
GastlyTrinket.Level3: Hypnosis affects enemies further away. Gastly has also learned Dream Eater!
CharLOLTrinket.Description:
What was I expecting from a strange man selling shinies.

Lv.{0}: {1}
CharLOLTrinket.Level1: Tries to convince the player that it is Charmander.

KoffingTrinket.Description:
Spews out noxious gases at enemies.

Lv.{0}: {1}
KoffingTrinket.Level1: Attacks enemies with Smog, a putrid gas that continually deals damage.
KoffingTrinket.Level2:
Smog has been upgraded. Koffing has learned Smokescreen!
Attacks miss the player for 5 seconds after taking 15 damage or more.
KoffingTrinket.Level3: Koffing has mastered Smog! Smokescreen has reduced cooldown.
CuboneTrinket.Description:
Throws bones at enemies and finds items in dig spots.

Lv.{0}: {1}
CuboneTrinket.Level1: Attacks enemies with Bonemerang, a ranged bone attack with knockback.
CuboneTrinket.Level2: Bonemerang has been upgraded with increased stats all round!
CuboneTrinket.Level3: Cubone has mastered Bonemerang! It can use it more often and may land a critical hit.
PikachuTrinket.Description:
Attacks enemies from afar with a bolt of lighting.

Lv.{0}: {1}
PikachuTrinket.Level1: Pikachu uses Thunder on a single enemy. The damage can be unpredictable.
PikachuTrinket.Level2: Thunder has become a little more reliable. Pikachu has also learned to forage!
PikachuTrinket.Level3: Pikachu has mastered Thunder! Nearby enemies may get stunned for long periods.

ShadyTrader.Name: Strange Man
ShadyTrader.Fri: #$q Ans1_yes/Ans1_no ShadyTrader_fallback#Have I got a deal just for you!#$b#I'll let you have a secret Pokemon - a shiny Charmander - for just 20,000g!#$b#That's a pretty good deal if you ask me.#$b#So, what do you say?#$r Ans1_yes 0 Ans1_reaction_yes#Sure!#$r Ans1_no 0 Ans1_reaction_no#No thanks.
Ans1_reaction_yes: $query PLAYER_CURRENT_MONEY Current 20000 99999999#Great here you go!#$action AddMoney -20000#$action AddItem (TR)NITVPokemon_CharLOLTrinket 1#$action AddMail All NITV_ShadyTrader_Bought received|Sorry, but you don't have enough money.
TrinketTrader.Name: Tinker
TrinketTrader.Mon: Donating Pokemon to the Insectarium helps me develop new trinkets.
TrinketTrader.Wed: Pokemon make great trinkets, don't you think?
BuffAnvil.InvalidItem: Trinket is already at max level
BuffAnvil.Description: Increases the level of Pokemon Trinkets
Group1.mail: Pokemon should now begin spawning in the Valley.
Group1Safari.mail: Pokemon should now begin spawning in the Safari Zone.
Group2.mail: A new group of Pokemon should now begin to spawn in the Valley.
Group2Safari.mail: That new group of Pokemon should now be able to spawn in the Safari Zone. Oh, and check the house there, I left the door open for you.
Group3.mail: Another new group of Pokemon should now begin to spawn in the Valley.
Group3Safari.mail: The newest group of Pokemon should now spawn in the Safari Zone.
SafariMap2.mail: A new part of the Safari Map is accessible. Sorry about the caves, they are still under construction.
Pidgey.displayDescription:
A Normal/Flying-type bird Pokemon with sharp eyesight and silent wingbeats.
It is usually quite friendly.
Geodude.displayDescription:
A Rock/Ground-type boulder Pokemon with immense strength.
It has no problems dealing with foes in the caves and mines.
Zubat.displayDescription: A Poison/Flying-type bat Pokemon with no eyes, navigating the caves and mines via ultrasonic cries.
Caterpie.displayDescription:
A Bug-type worm Pokemon that munches on leaves.
It can emit a pungent odor to deter predators while it flees from the bushes.
Weedle.displayDescription:
A Bug/Poison-type larva Pokemon with a venomous stinger on its head.
It can disguise itself as thorns on a bush.
Rattata.displayDescription:
A Normal-type rodent Pokemon with sharp incisors and agile paws.
It scavenges for food at night and doesn't hesitate to flee.
Magikarp.displayDescription:
A Water-type fish Pokemon known for feeble splashes and flops.
Despite its weakness, it holds hidden potential for a mighty evolution.
Metapod.displayDescription:
A Bug-type cocoon Pokemon that clings to branches.
Its shell hardens to protect itself during metamorphosis.
Kakuna.displayDescription:
A Bug/Poison-type cocoon Pokemon with an extremely tough exoskeleton.
It may look harmless but it can still sting you.
Butterfree.displayDescription: A Bug/Flying-type Pokemon whose powdery wings scatter toxic spores and hypnotic scales to lull foes.
Beedrill.displayDescription:
A Bug/Poison-type Pokemon with razor-sharp stingers on its forelegs.
It can strike in coordinated multi-attacks.
Ekans.displayDescription:
A Poison-type Pokemon that slithers silently through the grass.
It coils around its prey before striking with venomous fangs.
Poliwag.displayDescription: A Water-type Pokemon whose swirling belly pattern can mesmerize foes when it twirls rapidly in battle.
Tentacool.displayDescription:
A Water/Poison-type Pokemon that drifts through the sea.
It has toxic tentacles which are often used to ensnare attackers.
Growlithe.displayDescription:
A Fire-type Pokemon noted for fierce loyalty.
Its fiery breath protects friends and wards off any threat.
Venonat.displayDescription:
A Bug/Poison-type Pokemon with large red eyes and soft fur.
It releases toxic powder from its forehead to disorient foes.
Paras.displayDescription: A Bug/Grass-type Pokemon whose parasitic mushrooms on its back secrete special nutrients.
Diglett.displayDescription:
A timid Ground-type Pokemon that tunnels at high speed underground.
It may pop up unexpectedly to surprise you.
Sandshrew.displayDescription:
A Ground-type Pokemon with armor-like scales.
It can roll around on the desert sands to escape danger or cause injury.
Gastly.displayDescription:
A Ghost/Poison-type Pokemon with a dark gaseous form.
It haunts dark corners and smiles at your misfortune.
Shiny.extraDescription:
Shiny Pokemon are rare variants with a slightly different appearance.
They are often sought after by Pokemon collectors.
Oddish.displayDescription:
A shy sprout that peeks out from under leaves.
It can sometimes be seen sleeping on tree stumps.
Bellsprout.displayDescription:
A plant that sways and waits for prey.
It is known to move at blinding speed to snap at passing bugs.
Pikachu.displayDescription:
A lively rodent that stores electricity in its cheeks.
It appears during storms, drawing upon lightning strikes.
Grimer.displayDescription:
A sludge-like blob that moves slowly across sewer walls and floors.
This can often leave a trail of sticky poison behind.
Koffing.displayDescription:
A geyser-like ball Pokemon that drifts lazily, puffing out foul gases.
It feeds on fumes from rotting trash.
Spearow.displayDescription:
A scrappy little bird Pokemon that thrives in hot, arid conditions.
It can be aggressive when it is hungry.
Rhyhorn.displayDescription: A bulky rock Pokemon that is completely unaffected by the hot, dry sands of the desert.
Cubone.displayDescription:
A desert dwelling Pokemon known for being cautious.
It carries a bone and is quick to defend itself against threats.
Goldeen.displayDescription:
A Pokemon that swims amongst other river fish.
Its sharp horn is known to catch inexperienced anglers off guard.
Shellder.displayDescription:
A tough shelled Pokemon resembling a clam.
It uses its long tongue to feed but only when it is safe.
Psyduck.displayDescription:
A large duck-like Pokemon that loves being around bodies of water.
It may look lazy but it is cautious and quick to flee.
